required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Progesterone and Atomoxetine for Cocaine Cessation
clinical_study.official_title: Progesterone and Atomoxetine for Cocaine Cessation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the role of progesterone (a hormone found in both men and women) on stopping cocaine use. The study will examine whether the medication, in combination with behavior therapy will decrease cocaine use, cigarette smoking, withdrawal symptoms, impulsivity and stress.

clinical_study.why_stopped: All clinical trials within the Department of Psychiatry at UMN were suspended and this study was withdrawn due to no enrollment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.description: Self report of the following subjective questionnaires: (1) Behavioral Inhibition Activation Scales, (2) Barratt Impulsivity Scale, and (3) Brief Self Control Scale.

arm_group.description: Two placebos are given for 84 days.
Progesterone (200 mg twice daily) and a placebo are given
